metadata.title: CVE-2011-4458 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Best Practical Solutions RT 3.6.x, 3.7.x, and 3.8.x before 3.8.12 and 4.xbefore 4.0.6, when the VERPPrefix and VERPDomain options are enabled,allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via unspecified vectors,a different vulnerability than CVE-2011-5092 and CVE-2011-5093.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2011-4458` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

request-tracker4 - 4.0.5-3
rt4-apache2 - 4.0.5-3
rt4-clients - 4.0.5-3
rt4-db-mysql - 4.0.5-3
rt4-db-postgresql - 4.0.5-3
rt4-db-sqlite - 4.0.5-3
rt4-fcgi - 4.0.5-3
rt4-standalone - 4.0.5-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: request-tracker4 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.5-3').
